description: Variation of condition 1 (plans) of application 22/02378/HOU (Date of Decision: 14/11/2022)(Demolition of existing rear extension, conversion of garage into habitable space, erection of two-storey side, part two storey/part single storey rear extension. Erection of roof extension with rear/ side dormer and rear juliet balcony and installation of 2 nos front rooflights to facilitate loft conversion. Internal alterations and associated rear landscaping.) variation to include widening of side wall by 160mm.
decision_conditions: It has not been demonstrated that the proposed solar panels would not be visible within the streetscene so officers have been unable to confirm that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development. The construction of the single storey rear extension and associated infrastructure along/over the site boundary and alterations to the first floor window would result in the development appearing visually dominant when viewed from neighbouring properties, harming the character and appearance of the area. The proposed development is therefore contrary to Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012), the Residential Design SPD (2013) and the NPPF (2023).

It has not been demonstrated that the proposed works could be achieved within the red line boundary of the site and the first floor bay window would result in an unacceptable loss of privacy to neighbouring gardens. It is therefore considered that the proposed development would have an unacceptable adverse impact upon the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance contrary to Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).
